title.narrative: Number of low-income Kenyan youth faciliated to gain high quality sklls for careers in technology

description.narrative:
Programme/Project Objective 1 To increase access to Moringa School’s high quality ‘introduction to programming’ course curriculum for partner secondary schools (SPOC)
Outcome 1 Introduce over 500 high school students across Kenya to the basics of software engineering in order to spur a desire to pursue a career in technology.
Outcome indicator % of students who go from one term’s content to the next.
Baseline 2018 30% moving from term to term Target 2020 500 (60% moving from term to term)
Programme/Project Objective 2 To encourage more youth to pursue high quality skills for careers in technology, many of which yield high job prospects through Moringa Prep and Core
Outcome 1 Administer a sponsorship program for 130 low-income students to undertake Moringa Prep and core courses.
Outcome indicator 1 % of low-income scholarship graduates (from Core) that find employment within six months.
Baseline 2018 0% (job placement for low income students was at nil as there was no scholarship programme with middle and higher income students having a rate of 95% job placement. Target 2020 90% job placement
Outcome 2 Students on scholarship transitioning through Prep and Core
Outcome indicator # of low-income students completing both Prep and Core
Baseline 2018 30 Core graduates on scholarship Target 2020 100 Core graduates on income
